CatDescriptText: Mr. David Robinson, animal keeper, 122 Hemlock Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 31, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the District Attorney's office and the courts are exerting all out efforts in prosecuting equal rights cases in which Negroes are the victims?"  Answer reads: "No. If you tell me that there has been only one conviction since around 1935 there is the evidence right there."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of David Robinson, wearing dark striped jacket with missing button, dark cap, and eyeglasses, holding paper bag, standing in front of brick wall
